sentence.text: However, the clinical significance and precise role of regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II in cancer progression are largely unknown.

entity.text: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Zinc finger protein 687 (regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II), identified as a C2H2 zinc finger protein, has been found to be mutated and upregulated in giant cell tumor of bone and acute myeloid leukemia, suggesting an oncogenic role for ZNF687 in cancer.

entity.text: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Herein, we report that ZNF687 was markedly upregulated in hepatocellular carcinoma (phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation) cell lines and HCC tissues, and was significantly correlated with relapse-free survival in HCC.
